record.jsxtip: the name of the node as it will appear in the XML message that will be created/processed
if set to a specific URI, the node name will be auto-prefixed (QName) to designate the target namespace
for encoded messages, the data type to encode
for encoded messages, the namespace for the data type
set to '1' to denote that this node is a simple type (http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema). For example: string, int, href
if '1', this node is abstract and only exists in the rules tree, not the final XML message
unique ID assigned by the system when the rule node was created
'XSL Path' to locate the source node in the pattern master that was used to create the selected rule node
